website_summaries.verdict: A concert brass baritone for intermediate players with stainless steel pistons and a lacquered yellow body.
pros: Included case is soft on the outside but hard on the inside to protect the bell
Experienced players agree it’s a good choice for beginners
cons: Players may have difficulty producing lower notes with the included mouthpiece and may want to replace it with a better one

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this horn at the beginning of the school year, in September 2019. My son has been learning on it all year. The horn is surprisingly nice! The valves are all well tooled and work well. There is a bit of a challenge for new players to figure out where the spit is to empty, but all of the loops are easily removable as long as you have them greased. The instrument has a good sound. Mouth piece was junk, after putting a small bore 6 1/2 mouth piece on the instrument, the sound was very rich. For the price, this instrument is a good little investment.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great price and nice sounding
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this horn and found it to be a superior instrument compared to the one I bought 11 years ago. It is light weight and easy to handle. It sounds good and is quite compact. I started playing brass instrument way back in 1973 starting with the sousaphone so I know my brass instruments. It's A nice sounding horn that's worth it's weight in brass.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good but can't clear spit.
customer_reviews.text: The instrument looks great and sounds good. The accessories are great. My only and major issue is that no matter what I do, I am unable to clear the spit or condensation that is created from playing it. There is only 1 spit valve and that doesn't clear the spit. I have continuously removed all of the slides in an attempt to rid the instrument of the spit however nothing works. After 10 minutes of playing the instrument, it crackles terribly due to built up spit that can't seem to be removed.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Murray

customer_reviews.title: but am told it has a nice tone.
customer_reviews.text: I gave to my grandson to use it in Jr. High band. I personally have not seen it, but am told it has a nice tone.
customer_reviews.author: carol veazey

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its a marching band baritone so it is smaller if you need a traditional instrument. Have to adjust your notes if using for just band.
customer_reviews.author: dawn

customer_reviews.title: real nice
customer_reviews.text: Just got my purchase, played it a little and the sound isn't the best, but it plays real easy and everything works great. Only problem I have is with the case, can't figure how the straps are to be put on to carry it. They should include some instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Sandywavshi

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loved his new Baritone!
customer_reviews.text: It is a beautiful looking instrument. The case is sturdy and strong , but yet it is light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Karen VanMeter

customer_reviews.title: Assembled incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago and it didn't work. I just figured out that when they put the valves in they put them in the wrong order. I had to unscrew and put them in correctly. It works okay now. Not great but good enough for my son to practice.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: It was a good deal! Im glad we bought it from here
customer_reviews.text: It was a good deal! Im glad we bought it from here. Our son is just starting out on the bartone in band and it sounds the same as the bigger baratones.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah W.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter instrument for my 4th grader, does well.
customer_reviews.author: SRP

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for elementary school child, small for teenager 13+. Sound is good, nice carrier case.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Everything seemed fine at first...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to use in 7th grade band. It seemed to be working out for him until one day he came home and told me that his baritone was not producing a sound that satisfied his teacher. Something about the size of the "bore." This should be fine for practice at home, but it may not be adequate for middle and high school bands.
customer_reviews.author: Alan C. Schriver

customer_reviews.title: Approved by the school music teacher
customer_reviews.text: My son started music class this year and we were initially planning to lease the equipment but when I saw this on Amazon I decided to take a chance and buy it as the lease cost for a year was similar to the cost of this instrument. I bought at such a time that I should be able to return it within 30 days if the music teacher does not approve it. BTW the music teacher had send an email to all the student not to buy the instruments over the internet. Long story short the music teacher tested this himself and approved it
customer_reviews.author: M. Tareen

customer_reviews.title: Instrument is fine if you know what you are ordering
customer_reviews.text: Instrument is fine if you know what you are ordering. The description says 30". That is the box, not the instrument. The instrument is only 23". It is kinda small for what I thought a baritone was. I felt silly for not knowing.
customer_reviews.author: rod buhrman

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson to take private lessons. It is a good product for the money and fast service. No complaints. Better than the school's band instruments. His instructor says it is good for the practice he needs to do.
customer_reviews.author: CofC&K

customer_reviews.title: Son's music teacher says it is good enough.
customer_reviews.text: I know next to nothing....well make that absolutely nothing about baritones. All I know was that I was paying $55 a month to rent one for my 10 year old for his school lessons. I bought this on a whim. I was releived when my son's music teacher told him that it is good. If it is good enough for the expert it is good enough for me. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Nath Venkit

customer_reviews.title: Very good Teacher likes it My son is happy with
customer_reviews.text: Very good Teacher likes it My son is happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY, HAPPY GRANDSON
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is absolutely thrilled with everything. The purchase made him a star to his music teacher.
customer_reviews.author: Malaine G. Herold

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This instrument is working great for my beginning player at school.
customer_reviews.author: Glad to be past this stage!

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - TOTAL CRAP
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete piece of crap. It arrived and within 2 weeks required repair and, despite the repair, it is unusable. The valves do not fit and the instrument is not playable. Do not buy this instrument.
customer_reviews.author: MLC

customer_reviews.title: Same price as renting one for a year
customer_reviews.text: Good starter Baritone for child. Last year we rented one for the school year and it cost us $350. For just about the same price we purchased one and the school music teacher stated it was a good size and quality for our 5th grader. When our son outgrows or needs a better one, we can donate it to the school.
customer_reviews.author: nycjenny

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the frustration for an elementary student
customer_reviews.text: Had a student arrive in class with one of these, and it is not worth the money you'll spend on it. The frustration level of a 5th or 6th grader playing a Mendini instrument is enough to make any kid want to quit band. The valves don't last very long, and the instrument plays out of tune. Plus when I've tried to send Mendini instruments to the repair shop, the repair technician is not able to order repair parts, rendering the instrument useless. Save your money and buy a brand that sells repair parts.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: We've had it 2 months and so far so good! No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 year old who was just starting lessons. Couldn't rent one under $60/mo, so I figured it was with trying. We've had it 2 months and so far so good! No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Scuz

customer_reviews.title: awesome find!
customer_reviews.text: My 8th grader was happy to finally stop renting a beat up old Baritone. The case is super lite, yet protects perfectly! Thank you seller
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Mendini MBR-30 Intermediate Brass B Flat Baritone with Stainless Steel Pistons
product_meta.description: Mendini by Cecilio MBR-30 intermediate baritone horn is equipped with a rose-brass lead pipe, which gives this instrument a warm, rich, and full-bodied sound. The lightweight and 9" bell design will compliment players at all performance levels. This model uses 3 top action valves with stainless steel pistons for fast and responsive action.
feature_bullets: Lacquered yellow brass body and bell intermediate Bb baritone horn
Lightweight, .528" bore, 9" upright bell, 3 stainless steel smooth top action pistons
Includes: silver plated mouthpiece, pro-deluxe hard case, polishing cloth and a pair of gloves
Bonus: Cecilio 92-D chromatic/string tuner with metronome

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars37 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
